samples.context: If the oven breaks, dinner gets delayed. If dinner is delayed, people get hungry. If traffic is bad, the commute takes longer. If the commute takes longer, people arrive home late. Today, either the oven broke, or there was bad traffic, or both.
samples.question: No one was hungry for dinner. Did they arrive home late?

samples.context: If it's the weekend, the mall gets crowded. If the mall is crowded, parking is hard to find. If there's a big sale, people will wait in long lines. If people wait in lines, they get impatient. Today, either it was the weekend, or there was a big sale, or both.
samples.question: Parking was easy today. Were people impatient?

samples.context: If the sun is out, the pool gets crowded. If the pool gets crowded, there's a long wait for the waterslides. If it's payday, people go shopping. Today, either the sun was out, or it was payday, or both happened.
samples.question: There was no long wait for the waterslides today. Did people go shopping?

samples.context: If the electricity goes out, the house becomes very dark. If it is dark inside, people will turn on flashlights to see. If the internet also goes down, electronics will not work. Either there was a power outage today, or the internet went down, or both things occurred.
samples.question: The house did not become dark. Were the electronics not working?

samples.context: If the wi-fi is down, devices won't connect to the internet. If devices can't connect, people get frustrated. If people are frustrated, they complain a lot. Yesterday, either the wi-fi was down, or people were complaining, or both things happened.
samples.question: There were no connection issues. Were people complaining yesterday?

samples.context: If the stove catches fire, the smoke alarm will go off loudly. If the smoke alarm goes off, people will evacuate the building. If there is a fire drill, the alarm will still ring. Earlier today, either there was a real fire or just a drill, or maybe both things occurred.
samples.question: Nobody evacuated today. Did the smoke alarm go off?

samples.context: If a business has many customers, they will make a good profit. If a business makes a good profit, they can expand and grow. If a business has to close locations, they will lay off employees. Last quarter, either the company had many customers, or they closed locations, or possibly both took place.
samples.question: There were no layoffs. Did the business expand and grow?

samples.context: If the bus breaks down, students arrive late to school. If students arrive late, first period is disrupted. If it is raining, the soccer game is canceled. Today, either the bus broke down, or it rained, or both things occurred.
samples.question: First period was not disrupted. Was the soccer game canceled?

samples.context: If it's windy, kites can fly high. If kites fly high, they're fun to watch. If the fair is in town, parking is hard to find. Today, either it was windy, or the fair was in town, or both were true.
samples.question: Kites were not fun to watch today. Was parking hard to find?

samples.context: If it is cloudy, then it might rain later. If it rains, the grass gets wet. If the grass is wet, kids can jump in puddles. Either it was cloudy today, or kids were jumping in puddles, or both things happened.
samples.question: There was no wet grass today. Were kids jumping in puddles?

samples.context: If it's someone's birthday, there is usually a party. If there is a party, there is loud music. If there is loud music, neighbors get annoyed. Last night either it was someone's birthday, or the neighbors were annoyed, or both occurred.
samples.question: The neighbors were not annoyed last night. Was it someone's birthday?

samples.context: If the bus is late, students are tardy for school. If students are tardy, they have to serve detention. If it is picture day, students dress up nicely. Either the bus was late, or it was picture day, or both things happened today.
samples.question: No students had to serve detention. Did they dress up nicely for pictures?

samples.context: If it rains a lot, there will be big puddles on the ground. If there are big puddles, kids will splash in them. If the electricity goes out, the house will be dark inside. Last night, either it rained a lot or the power went out, or maybe both things happened.
samples.question: There were no big puddles today. Was the house dark inside?

samples.context: If the wifi is down, online games cannot be played. If games cannot be played, kids are bored. If the power goes out, all devices turn off. This afternoon, either the wifi went down, or the power went out, or both things happened.
samples.question: The kids were not bored. Did the power go out?

samples.context: If a team plays very well, they will win the game. If a team wins the game, the fans will celebrate. If it rains on game day, the field gets muddy. Last weekend, either the home team played very well, or it rained, or perhaps both occurred.
samples.question: The fans did not celebrate. Was the field muddy?
